text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Buddha

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

text: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
author: Mark Twain

text: Always acknowledge a fault. This will throw those in authority off their guard and give you an opportunity to commit more.
author: Mark Twain

text: There are only two kinds of people in the end: those who say to God, 'Thy will be done,' and those to whom God says, in the end, 'Thy will be done.'
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter and those who matter don't mind.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
author: Confucius

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.
author: Charles Dickens

text: It is our choices...that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Never trust anything that can think for itself if you can't see where it keeps its brain.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: It is our choices...that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

text: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
author: George S. Patton

text: When you reach the end of your rope, tie a knot in it and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

text: If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
author: Allen Saunders

text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
author: William Shakespeare

text: If you don't stand for something you will fall for anything.
author: Gordon A. Eadie

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

text: Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well.
author: Mark Twain

text: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

text: Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car.
author: Garrison Keillor

text: If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: God judges men according to the use they make of the light which He gives them.
author: Joseph Smith

text: The message of the restored gospel of Jesus Christ is that we can and must expect to become better as long as we live
author: Henry B. Eyring

text: We are to be positive and of good cheer. We emphasize our faith, not our fears.
author: Quentin L. Cook

text: Remember that the Lord will shape the back to bear the burden placed upon it.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: Challenges help us become more like our Father in Heaven.
author: Richard G. Scott

text: Our destiny is not determined by the number of times we stumble but by the number of times we rise up, dust ourselves off, and move forward.
author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

text: Day after day, on your path toward your eternal destiny, increase your faith. Proclaim your faith! Let your faith show!
author: Russell M. Nelson

text: Heavenly Father and the Savior are our perfect examples. …They never force righteousness because righteousness must be chosen.
author: Henry B. Eyring

text: It is important to rise above rationalizations and make the best choices.
author: Quentin L. Cook

text: Each day is a day of decision, and our decisions determine our destiny.
author: Russell M. Nelson

text: God cares a lot more about who we are and who we are becoming than about who we once were.
author: Dale G. Renlund

text: Exaltation is our goal; discipleship is our journey.
author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

text: We will not accidentally come to believe in the Savior and His gospel.
author: L. Whitney Clayton

text: Spiritual food is necessary for spiritual survival.
author: Dallin H. Oaks

text: We are to be positive and of good cheer. We emphasize our faith, not our fears.
author: Quentin L. Cook

text: Remember ... What is impossible for you is possible with God’s help in His service.
author: Henry B. Eyring

text: The future of your faith is not by chance, but by choice.
author: Neil L. Anderson

text: Godly fear dispels mortal fears.
author: David A. Bednar

text: Fear is dispelled through a correct knowledge of and faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.
author: David A. Bednar

text: We must remember that the same forces of resistance which prevent our progress afford us also opportunities to overcome.
author: Howard W. Hunter

text: The answers to our greatest questions come to us as we are obedient to the commandments of God.
author: Thomas S. Monson

text: Selective obedience brings selective blessings.
author: Jörg Klebingat

text: It is important to recognize that God’s ultimate purpose is our progress.
author: D. Todd Christofferson

text: Faithfully caring for the poor and needy is a reflection of spiritual maturity.
author: Dean M. Davies

text: Reaching out to rescue one another, under any condition, is an eternal measure of love.
author: Ronald A. Rasband

text: The way to feel better about your own situation is to improve someone else’s circumstances.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

text: Absolute truth exists in a world that increasingly disdains and dismisses absolutes.
author: David A. Bednar

text: Now is the time to align our goals with God’s goals. His work and His glory—"to bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man"—can become ours.
author: Russell M. Nelson

text: You have the Savior of the world on your side. If you seek His help and follow His directions, how can you fail?
author: Gary E. Stevenson

text: One of God’s greatest gifts to us is the joy of trying again, for no failure ever need be final.
author: Thomas S. Monson
